MEDICAL SUPPORT ASSISTANT (OA) GS-5 STEP 2

SUMMARY

Committed and motivated medical support assistant with exceptional customer service and decision making skills.
Strong work ethic, professional demeanor and great initiative.
Proficient at quickly learning new procedures and taking ownership of diverse projects.
Highlights
Patient scheduling abilities Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  Flexibility Reception area management
Detail-oriented  Self-starter Team player

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Certificate of Acheivement

Manages templates for 3 providers
substitutes for absent medical support assistants to ensure there is coverage  Provide on the job training to newly assigned employees maintain appointment calendars to schedule and/or cancel appointments.  Knowledgeable of  Defense Civilian Payroll System (DCPS), Automated Time and Attendance Production System (ATAAPS), Civilian Personnel OnLine (CPOL) provide clerical/administrative and automation support using multiple computer systems and technologies, including Microsoft office (MS Access, MS Powerpoint, MS Excel, MS Word and MS) Well versed to systems such as Composite Health Care System (CHCS), Allied Health Longitudinal Technology Application (AHLTA), Defense Manpower Human Resource System Information (DMHRSI).

Organized medications for pharmacist to dispense by reading medication orders and prescriptions; preparing labels; calculating quantities; assembling intravenous solutions and other pharmaceutical therapies.
Maintained records by recording and filing physicians' orders and prescriptions.
Generated revenues by calculating, recording, and issuing charges.
Ensured medication availability by delivering medications to patients and departments.
Prepared reports by collecting and summarizing information.
Contributed to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

<JD_START>
Job Title: CAS Air Force Writer / Intel Analyst

Location: Leesville, LA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Duties

Member of a five-man exercise CAOC, actively participate in scenario development processes to ensure air power is appropriately integrated. Monitor conduct of CAS missions and write analyses of those missions. Responsible for multiservice air integration into JRTC scenarios. Participates in rotational planning meetings in order to assist the Air Force 548 CTS integrate CAS in JRTC rotations. Responsible for replicating the functions of a USAF Combined Air Operation Center (CAOC) including the production of ATOs, ACOs and SPINS and processing pre-planned CAS requests. Air Intelligence cell produces DISUMs, INTREPs, ELINTREPS, and enemy Order of Battle daily updates as necessary and distributes them to exercise players. Tracks execution of CAS missions and writes mission analyses of those missions. Participates in rotational planning meetings, conducts briefings as required, and assists the Air Force in constructing After Action Reviews (AARs). 

Position Requirements

Qualifications

Required Experience:

Experience in preparation/executing debriefing military exercise/training (such as JRTC rotations) and responsibilities. 

Desired

Experience in numbered Air Force or higher headquarters. Experience working in an Air Operations Center or equivalent JRTC experience. Intelligence operations or aircrew experience in Close Air Support. Degree from an accredited college or university. Completion of Air Command and Staff College or equivalent.

Additional Requirements

Must be proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint.Able to travel unaccompanied to continental US and foreign locations.Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Must submit to and pass pre-employment drug screening; will be subject to random drug screening.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
